canonical_explanation.text: Air is all around us. We cannot see air, but we can feel it when the wind blows. All living things need air to breathe and stay alive. People, animals, and plants all breathe air. Air is very useful to us. We use air for breathing, flying kites, drying clothes on a clothesline, running windmills, and sailing boats. Moving air is called wind. Sometimes the wind blows gently and sometimes it blows very fast. Smoke from factories and vehicles, and dust from roads make the air dirty. This is called air pollution. Dirty air is bad for our health. Trees and plants help clean the air. We should plant more trees to keep the air clean.
rules: Air is all around us, but we cannot see it.
All living things need air to breathe.
Air is used for breathing, flying kites, drying clothes, windmills, and sailing boats.
Smoke and dust make the air dirty (air pollution).
Trees give us clean air and help fight air pollution.

questions.question_text: All living things need ___ to breathe.
questions.explanation_correct: All living things need air to breathe. People, animals, and plants all take in air to stay alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While living things also need water and food, the thing we breathe is air. We breathe air in and out through our nose and mouth.

questions.question_text: Can we see air?
questions.explanation_correct: We cannot see air. Air is invisible. But we can feel it when the wind blows on our face or moves our hair.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is not blue, green, or white. We cannot see it at all. But we know it is there because we can feel it.

questions.question_text: What helps a kite fly in the sky?
questions.explanation_correct: Air (wind) helps a kite fly in the sky. The wind pushes the kite up and keeps it flying high.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water, mud, and stones cannot make a kite fly. Moving air, which is wind, lifts the kite and keeps it in the sky.

questions.question_text: What makes the air dirty?
questions.explanation_correct: Smoke from vehicles makes the air dirty. Cars, buses, and trucks release smoke that pollutes the air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees and flowers actually help clean the air. Rain helps wash dust away. Smoke from vehicles is what makes air dirty.

questions.question_text: Moving air is called:
questions.explanation_correct: Moving air is called wind. When air moves from one place to another, we feel it as wind.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rain is falling water. Snow is frozen water. Clouds are in the sky. Moving air is called wind.

questions.question_text: What do we breathe in through our nose?
questions.explanation_correct: We breathe in air through our nose. Air goes into our body and helps us stay alive and active.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not breathe in water, food, or milk through our nose. We breathe air. Air enters our body through the nose.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a use of air?
questions.explanation_correct: Air helps dry wet clothes. When we hang wet clothes on a line, the moving air takes away the water and makes them dry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Writing, reading, and painting do not use air. Drying wet clothes on a clothesline is a common use of air and wind.

questions.question_text: Trees help us by giving us:
questions.explanation_correct: Trees give us clean air. They take in dirty air and give out fresh, clean air that we need to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees do not give dirty air, smoke, or dust. They clean the air and give us the fresh air we breathe.

questions.question_text: Air is:
questions.explanation_correct: Air is found everywhere around us. It is inside our homes, outside, on the playground, in classrooms, and everywhere else.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is not found only inside or only outside. It is everywhere around us, filling all the space that is not filled by something else.

questions.question_text: A windmill is turned by:
questions.explanation_correct: A windmill is turned by wind, which is moving air. The wind pushes the big blades of the windmill and makes them spin.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Windmills are not turned by water, fire, or sunlight. They use the power of wind (moving air) to spin their blades.

questions.question_text: Smoke from factories causes:
questions.explanation_correct: Smoke from factories causes air pollution. The smoke makes the air dirty and unhealthy to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Factory smoke does not clean the air or cause rain or wind. It makes the air dirty, which is called air pollution.

questions.question_text: When we blow up a balloon, we fill it with:
questions.explanation_correct: When we blow up a balloon, we fill it with air from our lungs. The air makes the balloon get bigger and rounder.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not fill balloons with water, sand, or milk when we blow them up. We blow air from our mouth into the balloon.

questions.question_text: Which of these needs air to breathe?
questions.explanation_correct: A bird needs air to breathe because it is a living thing. All living things need air to stay alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Stones, chairs, and books are non-living things and do not need air. Only living things like birds breathe air.

questions.question_text: How can we feel air?

options.text: When wind blows on our face

questions.explanation_correct: We can feel air when wind blows on our face or moves our hair. Even though we cannot see air, we can feel it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cannot see, taste, or count air. But we can feel it when the wind blows against us.

questions.question_text: A sail boat moves on water using:
questions.explanation_correct: A sail boat uses wind to move on water. The wind pushes the sail and makes the boat glide forward.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sail boats do not use petrol or batteries. They have big sails that catch the wind. The wind pushes them forward.

questions.question_text: Dust in the air is:
questions.explanation_correct: Dust in the air is bad for our health. Breathing dusty air can cause coughing and make us sneeze and feel unwell.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dust is not good for health, not tasty, and not helpful for plants. It makes the air dirty and can cause health problems.

questions.question_text: If there was no air, living things would:

options.text: Not be able to breathe and would die

questions.explanation_correct: If there was no air, living things would not be able to breathe and would die. Air is needed by all living things to stay alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Without air, we would not be happy, grow faster, or become stronger. We would not survive because we need air to breathe.

questions.question_text: Which of these helps clean the air?
questions.explanation_correct: Trees help clean the air. They take in dirty air and give out fresh, clean air. That is why planting trees is very important.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars, factories, and buses release smoke that makes air dirty. Only trees help clean the air by giving us fresh air.

questions.question_text: We use a fan to feel cool air in our:
questions.explanation_correct: We use fans in our homes and classrooms to move the air around. This makes us feel cool and comfortable.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fans are not in pockets, shoes, or books. We use fans in rooms to move air and feel cool.

questions.question_text: Ritu held her hand in front of her mouth and blew. She felt something on her hand. What did she feel?
questions.explanation_correct: Ritu felt air on her hand. When we blow, air comes out of our mouth. Even though we cannot see it, we can feel it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: She did not feel water, light, or sound on her hand. She felt air. This shows that air is real even though we cannot see it.

questions.question_text: On Makar Sankranti, children fly kites. Kites fly high because of:
questions.explanation_correct: Kites fly high because of the wind blowing. The wind pushes the kite up into the sky. Without wind, a kite cannot fly well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Thread holds the kite, colour makes it pretty, and paper is what it is made of. But it is the wind that makes it fly.

questions.question_text: Amma hung wet clothes on a line outside. After some time, the clothes became dry. What helped dry them?
questions.explanation_correct: Air and sunlight helped dry the clothes. The air carried away the water from the clothes, and the sun's heat helped too.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The rope and clips hold the clothes, and colour does not matter. Air and sunlight work together to dry wet clothes.

questions.question_text: There are many cars and trucks on a busy road. The air near the road will be:
questions.explanation_correct: The air near a busy road will be dirty because of smoke from cars and trucks. Vehicle smoke causes air pollution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Busy roads are not clean or full of flowers. The smoke from vehicles makes the air dirty and unhealthy to breathe.

questions.question_text: Arun put an empty glass upside down into a tub of water. The water did not go inside the glass fully. Why?

options.text: Because air inside the glass took up space

questions.explanation_correct: Air inside the glass took up space and did not let the water in fully. This shows that air is real and takes up space, even though we cannot see it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The glass was not broken. The temperature or tub size did not matter. The air trapped inside the glass stopped the water from entering.

questions.question_text: Why should we plant more trees?

options.text: To have cleaner air to breathe

questions.explanation_correct: We should plant more trees so we have cleaner air to breathe. Trees take in dirty air and give out clean, fresh air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees do give shade too, but the most important reason to plant more trees is to keep our air clean and healthy.

questions.question_text: On a windy day, leaves on trees shake. Why?

options.text: Because the wind (moving air) pushes them

questions.explanation_correct: Leaves shake because the wind pushes them. Moving air (wind) has the power to move light things like leaves and flags.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaves do not feel scared or want to dance. They shake because the force of the wind pushes and moves them.

questions.question_text: A person is running fast and is out of breath. What does the body need more of?
questions.explanation_correct: When we run fast, our body needs more air. That is why we breathe faster and harder. Our body uses more air during exercise.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While our body also needs water and food, being out of breath means we need more air right now. That is why we pant.

questions.question_text: Geeta's mother told her not to stand behind a bus when its engine is on. Why?

options.text: The bus releases dirty smoke that is bad for health

questions.explanation_correct: Buses release dirty smoke from their exhaust pipe at the back. Breathing this smoke is bad for our lungs and health.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The size, noise, or colour of the bus is not the reason. The dangerous smoke coming from the bus exhaust is harmful to breathe.

questions.question_text: A fish lives in water. Does it need air?

options.text: No, fish do not need air
Yes, fish breathe air that is in the water
Yes, fish come out of water to breathe

questions.explanation_correct: Yes, fish need air too! There is air mixed in the water. Fish use their gills to take in this air from the water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All living things need air, including fish. Fish breathe the air that is dissolved in water. They do not need to come out of water.

questions.question_text: Burning crackers during Diwali makes the air:
questions.explanation_correct: Burning crackers makes the air dirty with smoke. The smoke from crackers causes air pollution and is not good for our health.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Crackers may look colourful, but the smoke they create makes the air very dirty. This is bad for everyone, especially people with breathing problems.

questions.question_text: Why do we feel fresh when we go to a park with many trees?
questions.explanation_correct: We feel fresh in parks because trees give clean, fresh air. The air around trees is cleaner and nicer to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Swings, benches, and the size of the park do not make the air fresh. It is the trees that clean the air and make it healthy.

questions.question_text: Name two uses of air.
questions.explanation_correct: Breathing and flying kites are two uses of air. We breathe air to stay alive, and wind helps kites fly in the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Reading, writing, eating, and sleeping do not directly use air. Breathing and flying kites are correct uses of air.

questions.question_text: What causes air pollution?
questions.explanation_correct: Air pollution is caused by smoke from vehicles and factories. This smoke has harmful things that make the air dirty and unhealthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Planting trees and watering plants actually help clean the air. Smoke from vehicles and factories is what causes air pollution.

questions.question_text: How do we know air is real if we cannot see it?

options.text: We can feel it when wind blows and see it move things

questions.explanation_correct: We know air is real because we can feel it when wind blows on us. We can also see it move things like leaves, flags, and kites.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is real even though it is invisible. We prove it exists by feeling wind, seeing things move in the breeze, and breathing it.

questions.question_text: Which is the best way to reduce air pollution?

options.text: Plant more trees and use bicycles

questions.explanation_correct: Planting more trees and using bicycles instead of cars helps reduce air pollution. Trees clean the air, and bicycles do not make smoke.
questions.explanation_incorrect: More factories, cars, and crackers create more smoke. Planting trees and cycling are cleaner choices that help keep the air clean.

questions.question_text: Plants also need air to live. True or false?

options.text: True, all living things need air
True, but only big trees need air

questions.explanation_correct: It is true that plants need air to live. All living things, including plants, need air. Plants use air to make their food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do need air, not just water. All living things, big or small, need air. Both animals and plants breathe air.

questions.question_text: What would happen if all the trees were cut down?

options.text: The air would become very dirty and we would have less clean air

questions.explanation_correct: If all trees were cut down, the air would become very dirty. Trees clean the air, so without them, we would have much less clean air to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees clean our air. Without trees, there would be more pollution and less fresh air. We would all find it harder to breathe.

questions.question_text: We need air to breathe.
questions.explanation_correct: We need air to breathe. Every time we breathe in through our nose, we take in air. Without air, we cannot survive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Breathing air is essential for life. All people, animals, and plants need air to live.

questions.question_text: We can see air.
questions.explanation_correct: We cannot see air. Air is invisible. But we can feel it when the wind blows and see it move things like leaves and flags.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is invisible. We cannot see it with our eyes. But we know it is there because we can feel the wind and breathe it.

questions.question_text: Wind helps kites fly.
questions.explanation_correct: Wind helps kites fly high in the sky. The moving air pushes the kite upward. Without wind, kites cannot fly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Wind is moving air, and it lifts kites up into the sky. That is why we fly kites on windy days.

questions.question_text: Smoke makes the air clean.
questions.explanation_correct: Smoke does NOT make the air clean. Smoke makes the air dirty and polluted. It is bad for our health to breathe smoky air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smoke makes air dirty, not clean. Smoke from vehicles and factories pollutes the air and causes breathing problems.

questions.question_text: A balloon gets bigger when we blow air into it.
questions.explanation_correct: When we blow air into a balloon, the air fills up the space inside and makes the balloon bigger. This shows air takes up space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The air we blow into a balloon fills it up and makes it grow bigger. Air takes up space.

questions.question_text: Only animals need air, not plants.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Both animals and plants need air. Plants use air to make food and to breathe, just like animals do.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants also need air to survive. All living things, including plants, animals, and people, need air.

questions.question_text: Planting trees helps clean the air.
questions.explanation_correct: Planting trees does help clean the air. Trees take in dirty air and give out clean, fresh air for us to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Trees are like natural air cleaners. They absorb dirty air and release clean, fresh air.

questions.question_text: Moving air is called wind.
questions.explanation_correct: When air moves from one place to another, we call it wind. Wind can be gentle or strong.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Wind is simply air that is moving. We can feel wind on our skin and see it move leaves and flags.

questions.question_text: Burning crackers helps clean the air.
questions.explanation_correct: Burning crackers does NOT clean the air. It makes the air very dirty with smoke and harmful gases. This is air pollution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Crackers produce a lot of smoke when they burn. This smoke makes the air dirty and causes air pollution.

questions.question_text: Air is found only outdoors.
questions.explanation_correct: Air is NOT found only outdoors. Air is everywhere, inside our homes, classrooms, shops, and even in bottles and bags.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air fills every open space. It is both indoors and outdoors. When you are sitting in your room, air is all around you.

questions.question_text: Windmills use the power of wind to work.
questions.explanation_correct: Windmills use the power of wind (moving air) to turn their big blades. This helps grind grain or make electricity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Wind pushes the blades of a windmill and makes them spin. This spinning motion can be used to do useful work.

questions.question_text: Vehicles release smoke that causes air pollution.
questions.explanation_correct: Vehicles like cars, buses, and trucks burn fuel and release smoke. This smoke goes into the air and causes air pollution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Vehicle smoke is one of the biggest causes of air pollution, especially in cities with many cars.

questions.question_text: We can feel air when the wind blows.
questions.explanation_correct: Even though we cannot see air, we can feel it when the wind blows on our face, moves our hair, or rustles leaves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Wind is moving air, and we can feel it on our skin. This is one way we know air is real.
